metadata.title: CVE-2016-7392 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the pstoedit_suffix_table_init function inoutput-pstoedit.c in AutoTrace 0.31.1 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (out-of-bounds write) via a crafted bmp image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7392` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

autotrace - 0.31.1-16+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
libautotrace3 - 0.31.1-16+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: autotrace package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.31.1-16+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
